Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting budget was very cheap at around $1 million, no one is likely to receive a Golden Globe or Oscar for their work on this movie, and they didn't even get a decent poster like one used in this review. Yet I was compelled to not only write a review about this movie, but even pay for it.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The film, based on Stephenie Meyer’s novel Midnight Sun, centers on 17-year-old Bella Swan, who moves to small town and falls in love with Edward Cullen, an eternal vampire. When Kathie’s epileptic son Jimmy is found drowned in their swimming pool, the case takes twists and turns
